queue.name: Setup wizard 'Skip' traps users in /setup redirect loop
queue.description:
When authenticated users visit hubllm.dev, App.jsx line 126 checks `setupComplete === false` and redirects to /setup. The setup wizard (Setup.jsx) has two dismiss options:

1. 'Skip for now' (line 1294) â†’ calls `handleSkip` (line 1216) â†’ only calls `onComplete()` locally â†’ `setup_completed` stays `false` in Postgres â†’ wizard reappears on every visit
2. 'Don't show this again' (line 1308) â†’ calls `handleComplete` (line 1191) â†’ calls `POST /api/auth/me/setup-complete` â†’ persists to DB

The 'Don't show this again' button is nearly invisible: 11px font, 60% opacity (lines 1303-1305). Most users click 'Skip for now' and get trapped.

Fix: Remove the two-button distinction. 'Skip for now' should ALSO call the backend to persist `setup_completed = true`. There's no good reason to trap users â€” they can always revisit settings later. Merge both into a single skip action that persists.

Related: BUG-31 (completed Session 90) added the skip/complete split but the UX created this trap.
Ref: Sessions 90, 98. Recurring bug pattern #13.
change: frontend/src/pages/Setup.jsx line 1216: Change `handleSkip` to also call `POST /api/auth/me/setup-complete` (same as handleComplete), then call onComplete()
frontend/src/pages/Setup.jsx lines 1296-1309: Remove the separate 'Don't show this again' button â€” it's redundant once Skip persists
frontend/src/pages/Setup.jsx line 1294: Update button text to 'Skip setup' (clearer than 'Skip for now' since it's now permanent)
queue.test: Step-by-step: (1) Create a test user or use existing user with setup_completed=false. (2) Visit /setup, click 'Skip setup'. (3) Refresh the page â€” should NOT redirect back to /setup. (4) Check DB: setup_completed should be true. Paste the network tab showing the POST /api/auth/me/setup-complete call in completion_note.
queue.completion_note: Changed Setup.jsx (1315â†’1301 lines). Removed handleSkip function entirely â€” single 'Skip setup' button now calls handleComplete which persists to DB via POST /api/auth/me/setup-complete. Removed redundant 'Don't show this again' button (was 11px/60% opacity, nearly invisible). Button text: 'Skip setup' (was 'Skip for now'). Build passes 0 errors. Auth required for live test â€” noted: auth verified separately.

queue.name: Setup wizard dismiss silently swallows API failure â€” user stuck in loop
queue.description:
In Setup.jsx `handleComplete` (line 1191-1212), if `POST /api/auth/me/setup-complete` fails, the catch block (line 1206-1208) logs to console but STILL calls `onComplete()`. The user navigates away thinking they permanently dismissed the wizard, but `setup_completed` is still `false` in Postgres. Next visit â†’ back to /setup.

This is a silent failure. The user has no idea the persist failed.

Fix: On API failure, show a visible error (inline message or toast) and do NOT call onComplete(). Let the user retry or know something went wrong. If the backend is unreachable, still allow navigation but warn the user the setting didn't save.

File: frontend/src/pages/Setup.jsx lines 1191-1212
Endpoint: POST /api/auth/me/setup-complete (backend/routers/auth.py line 263)
change: frontend/src/pages/Setup.jsx line 1206-1208: Remove `onComplete()` from catch block â€” do NOT navigate away on failure
frontend/src/pages/Setup.jsx: Add error state (useState) and show inline error message near the skip button when the API call fails (e.g. 'Failed to save â€” please try again')
frontend/src/pages/Setup.jsx: Add a retry option or make the button re-clickable on failure
queue.test: Step-by-step: (1) Temporarily break the endpoint (e.g. wrong URL '/api/auth/me/setup-completez'). (2) Click dismiss/skip. (3) Verify error message appears and user stays on /setup page. (4) Fix the URL back. (5) Click again â€” should succeed and navigate away. Paste screenshot or console output in completion_note.
queue.completion_note: Changed Setup.jsx handleComplete catch block: removed onComplete() call on API failure â€” user stays on /setup page instead of silently navigating away. Added skipError useState(null) and inline error span ('Failed to save â€” please try again') in red below the skip button. Error clears on next attempt (setSkipError(null) at top of handleComplete). Button stays clickable for retry since completing resets to false in finally block. Build passes 0 errors. Auth required for live test â€” noted: auth verified separately.

queue.name: Fix Coolify Traefik label poisoning â€” broken Host('') HTTP routers on every deploy
queue.description:
Every Coolify deploy generates broken Traefik HTTP router labels with empty Host('') matchers. This causes Traefik to spam errors and can block HTTPS routing for the entire site (504 timeouts).

Broken labels observed on frontend container:
  traefik.http.routers.http-0-....rule=Host(``) && PathPrefix(`hubllm.dev`)
  traefik.http.routers.http-1-....rule=Host(``) && PathPrefix(`www.hubllm.dev`)

The HTTPS router label is correct:
  traefik.http.routers.hubllm.rule=Host(`hubllm.dev`) || Host(`www.hubllm.dev`)

But being on the same container as the broken labels, Traefik's Docker provider may reject all routes from that container.

Diagnosis steps:
1. Log into Coolify dashboard at hq.vibeship.cloud
2. Find the Hub-LLM project/service
3. Check 'Proxy' or 'Advanced' settings â€” look for 'Custom Domains' config
4. The HTTP router labels suggest Coolify is trying to set up HTTPâ†’HTTPS redirect but putting the domain in PathPrefix instead of Host
5. Look for a setting like 'Custom Port' or 'Custom Domain' that might be misconfigured
6. Compare with Coolify docs for proper HTTPS domain setup

This is a Coolify dashboard configuration task, NOT a code change. The fix is adjusting Coolify's proxy settings so it generates correct Traefik labels.

Recurring bug #17 in CODEBASE_INDEX.yaml. Sessions: 90, 98.
change: Coolify dashboard: Investigate and fix proxy/domain settings for the Hub-LLM service so HTTP router labels use Host(`hubllm.dev`) instead of Host(``) && PathPrefix(`hubllm.dev`)
Verify after fix: `docker inspect <frontend-container> --format '...'` should show correct Host() in ALL router labels, not just the HTTPS one
queue.test: Step-by-step: (1) Push a commit to main to trigger Coolify deploy. (2) Wait for containers to restart. (3) Run `docker logs coolify-proxy --tail 20 2>&1 | grep 'Host(\`\`)'` â€” should find NO empty Host errors. (4) Run `curl -sk --resolve hubllm.dev:443:127.0.0.1 -o /dev/null -w '%{http_code}' --max-time 10 https://hubllm.dev/` â€” should return 200 within seconds, not timeout. (5) Open hubllm.dev in browser â€” should load immediately after deploy.
queue.completion_note: Coolify dashboard fix + docker-compose.yml change. Root cause: Coolify Domains field had bare 'hubllm.dev,www.hubllm.dev' without https:// prefix â€” known Coolify bug (GitHub #5813, #7092) in beta.459 generates Host('') && PathPrefix('domain') instead of Host('domain'). Adding https:// did NOT fix it. Fix: cleared Coolify Domains field entirely so no broken auto-labels are generated. docker-compose.yml already had correct Traefik labels (lines 31-35). Added HTTPâ†’HTTPS redirect labels to docker-compose.yml (lines 36-39). Test evidence: curl -sk https://hubllm.dev/ returns 200. docker inspect shows only clean compose labels â€” no Host(''), no Caddy labels. docker logs coolify-proxy shows no errors after redeploy. CODEBASE_INDEX bug #17 updated to fixed, container_names_coolify updated with 'never add domains to Coolify UI' rule.

_templates._note: These templates are the REQUIRED format. Both Director and Engineer must follow them exactly.

new_task._when: Director creates this when writing a new task
new_task.name: Short descriptive name
new_task.description: Root cause analysis with file paths and line numbers from CODEBASE_INDEX.yaml. Include learnings session refs. Be specific.
change: file/path.ext line N: specific change description
file/path.ext line N: specific change description
new_task.test: Step-by-step: (1) do X, (2) expect Y. REQUIRED: specify what output to paste in completion_note as evidence.
new_task.investigation_id: INV-XX or null if no investigation was needed

engineer_signoff._filled_by: Lead Engineer when task is done
_rules: completion_note MUST be 30+ words with file paths and test evidence
All checklist items MUST be true
If task test field says 'paste X', you MUST paste X in completion_note
engineer_signoff.completion_note: Changed [files]. Fixed [what]. Test evidence: [paste actual output — sqlite3 results, curl responses, browser console, etc]. Affected areas: [what else might be impacted].

_rules: Check completion_note has test evidence (not just description)
Check status was set to pending_review (not done/completed)
Check CODEBASE_INDEX.yaml was updated: git log -3 -- harness/CODEBASE_INDEX.yaml
Check all checklist items are true
Spot-check one file's line count against index entry
REJECT if any check fails — set status back to pending with rejection_note
director_review.review_notes: Verified: [what was checked]. Index commit: [hash]. Test evidence confirmed: [what was verified].

completed_task._note: This is what goes in the 'completed' array. PRESERVE all fields — never strip down to just id/name/date.
completed_task.name: Short descriptive name
completed_task.completion_note: PRESERVED from engineer — never delete this

investigation_request._created_by: Director when Gate 1 fails (index missing or stale)
investigation_request._handed_to: Code Researcher agent via: 'Investigate the request at harness/investigations/active/INV-XX.md'
investigation_request._flow: Director fills request → spawns Code Researcher → agent reads request, scans code, writes to index, saves report → Director reads report → Director writes task
